item.title: What to expect at TechCrunch All Stage: One day, countless connections and takeaways
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Whether you’re a founder gearing up for your next raise or a VC scouting your next portfolio win, TechCrunch All Stage, happening July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station, packs more into one day than most multi-day conferences manage to deliver. This isn’t your typical sit-and-listen event. It’s designed to help you build momentum in […]

item.title: Iconiq VCs spent two years courting Chime and the firm isn’t selling its stake
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Iconiq pursued Chime because the founders were focused, and didn’t get distracted by "shiny new objects."

item.title: Scale AI confirms ‘significant’ investment from Meta, says CEO Alexandr Wang is leaving
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Data-labeling firm Scale AI confirmed on Friday that it has received a "significant" investment from Meta that values the startup at $29 billion.

item.title: After a string of successes, early-stage fund Felicis raises fresh $900M
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Lately, Felicis, like most VCs, has been all over AI. Its portfolio now includes, for example, Browser Use, Poolside, Runway, and Supabase.

item.title: The Meta AI app is a privacy disaster
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Meta does not indicate to users what their privacy settings are as they post, or where they are even posting to. So, if you log into Meta AI with Instagram, and your Instagram account is public, then so too are your searches.

item.title: Bluesky backlash misses the point
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Not only is Bluesky more than just a Twitter/X alternative, it's just one app in a wider social ecosystem built on open technology.

item.title: Meta teams with XGS Energy to build a 150 MW geothermal power plant
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Meta is the latest tech company to warm to geothermal energy, announcing on Thursday a deal with startup XGS Energy to develop a 150 megawatt geothermal power plant in New Mexico.

item.title: Tesla sues former Optimus engineer over alleged trade secret theft
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Tesla alleges that Zhongjie Li stole confidential trade secrets and used them to launch a robotics startup a week after he left Tesla.

item.title: Google Cloud outage brings down a lot of the internet
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Google Cloud seems to be at the core of a major outage affecting popular internet apps and services on Thursday.

item.title: a16z-backed Infinite Machine shows off cheaper, modular electric scooter
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The Olto is the newest entry into the always-churning market for electric two-wheelers, and it will cost $3,495.

item.title: Hotel management platform Canary nabs $80M Series D from BPC, YC, Insight Partners
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Canary offers a product suite that encompasses every part of the guest journey, from booking to departure. The company offers services that let hotel guests check in on mobile devices or text the front desk for help. And it's leaning into AI in serving its customers’ guests through voice, web, and text with an LLM, sometimes offering instant responses.

item.title: Here are Apple’s top AI announcements from WWDC 2025
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: At WWDC 2025, Apple announced several AI features, such as a workout coach, live translation, and more.

item.title: Snapchat adds new features for creators, including an easier way to edit videos
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Snapchat is introducing a suite of new tools and features to make it easier for creators to post and share content on its platform.

item.title: Chime almost died in 2016, turned down by 100 VCs — today it IPO’d at $14.5B
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: In 2016 when Chime desperately needed cash, over 100 VCs said no. One seed VC took a chance and saved the company, co-founder Ryan King recalls.

item.title: Apple fixes new iPhone zero-day bug used in Paragon spyware hacks
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The iPhone maker quietly updated a February security advisory to publicize a flaw that was used to hack at least two journalists in Europe.

item.title: OpenAI and Barbie-maker Mattel team up to bring generative AI to toymaking, other products
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Barbie-maker Mattel and OpenAI have teamed up to bring generative AI to the toymaking and ever-expanding pipeline of IP repackaging.

item.title: Battery manufacturer Powin files for bankruptcy months after landing $200M loan
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Battery manufacturer Powin filed for bankruptcy on Wednesday. The Chapter 11 filing will let it continue operating while it restructures its debt.

item.title: Nothing’s new Phone 3 will be available for general sale in the US
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Smartphone startup Nothing will sell its next flagship model, the Nothing Phone (3), in the U.S. through its website and Amazon.

item.title: Instagram will finally let you rearrange your grid
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Instagram is finally going to let users rearrange their grid and is testing a way for users to quietly post to their profile without having the content appear in users' feeds.

item.title: Conveyor uses AI to automate the painful process of vendor security reviews and RFPs with AI
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Conveyor claims that its AI agent can fill out over 90% of customer security questions fully, autonomously, and accurately, saving customers many hours and accelerating their sales process. The 4-year-old startup nabbed a $20 million Series B from SignalFire.
